alert.note: Alert for Osborne; Smith (Kansas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Hastings (North Central Kansas and South Central Nebraska)
info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 04 at 3:49AM CST until January 05 at 12:00PM CST by NWS Hastings
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 9 AM THIS MORNING TO NOON CST FRIDAY... * WHAT...Light Freezing drizzle will be possible this morning and into the afternoon hours. Wet snow expected tonight. Total snow accumulations up to one inch. * WHERE...Portions of north central Kansas and south central Nebraska. * WHEN...From 9 AM this morning to noon CST Friday. * IMPACTS...Roads, and especially bridges and overpasses, will likely become slick and hazardous later this morning as a light glaze from freezing drizzle accumulates. Plan on slippery road conditions. The hazardous conditions should subside some by late afternoon before light snow begins across the area this evening. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...While overall snowfall accumulations will likely be less than one inch through the period, the combination of freezing drizzle ahead of the snow could make for hazardous road conditions.
info.instruction: Slow down and use caution while traveling. The latest road conditions for the state you are calling from can be obtained by calling 5 1 1. Be prepared for slippery roads. Slow down and use caution while driving. If you are going outside, watch your first few steps taken on stairs, sidewalks, and driveways. These surfaces could be icy and slippery, increasing your risk of a fall and injury.
